words.definition: To accept that something is true.
words.example: The teacher acknowledged that the student was right.

words.definition: A government worker who works in another country.
words.example: The ambassador works at the embassy.

words.definition: Light-colored hair.
words.example: She is a blonde with blue eyes.

words.definition: To attack and take control of a country.
words.example: The army tried to conquer the city.

words.definition: To pull something across the ground.
words.example: The dog was dragging the stick.

words.definition: To say something is bigger than it really is.
words.example: He exaggerated the size of the fish.

words.definition: The history and traditions of a country.
words.example: We must protect our cultural heritage.

words.definition: To say something rude to someone.
words.example: It is not polite to insult others.

words.definition: While something else is happening.
words.example: I cooked; meanwhile, he cleaned the room.

words.definition: Jewelry worn around the neck.
words.example: She wore a beautiful gold necklace.

words.definition: Having high moral qualities or high social rank.
words.example: He is a man of noble character.

words.definition: Having great value.
words.example: Diamonds are precious stones.

words.definition: An unfair opinion without knowing the facts.
words.example: We must fight against racial prejudice.

words.definition: Information that may not be true.
words.example: There is a rumor that he is leaving.

words.definition: Something that is against religious rules.
words.example: Lying is a sin in many religions.

words.definition: An exciting or unusual event.
words.example: The parade was a great spectacle.

words.definition: A neat pile of things.
words.example: There is a stack of books on the table.

words.definition: Feeling that something is wrong.
words.example: The police were suspicious of the man.

words.definition: A type of metal; a metal container.
words.example: The soup came in a tin.

words.definition: A container for flowers.
words.example: Put the flowers in the vase.
